seo.title: Certificate in Employee Benefits Law | IAML
seo.description: Master ERISA, HIPAA, COBRA & ACA compliance in this 4½-day certificate program. Earn SHRM & HRCI credits while building practical benefits administration expertise.
seo.keywords: employee benefits law, ERISA training, HIPAA compliance, COBRA administration, benefits law certificate, HR benefits certification, employee benefits compliance, welfare benefit plans, retirement plan compliance, SHRM PDC credits

hero.title: Certificate in Employee Benefits Law
hero.description: Benefits law mistakes cost companies millions in penalties and lawsuits. In 4½ days, you'll master the ERISA, ACA, and fiduciary strategies that keep your organization compliant and protected. Real regulations, practical solutions, immediate confidence.

content.headline: Build Benefits Law Expertise That Protects Plans and Limits Your Liability
content.description: The Certificate in Employee Benefits Law is 4.5 intensive days where you'll build expertise in ERISA compliance, retirement plan administration, and health care reform requirements with practicing benefits attorneys, working through the complex regulations that govern 401(k) plans, health benefits, and benefits litigation.

benefits.title: Complete benefits law coverage
benefits.description: ERISA fiduciary rules, 401(k) administration, nondiscrimination testing, ACA compliance, claims procedures, and DOL/IRS audit defense

benefits.title: Real-world application
benefits.description: Work through plan corrections, fiduciary breach scenarios, benefits claims appeals, and the regulatory challenges you'll face Monday morning

benefits.title: Expert benefits attorney instruction
benefits.description: Learn from practicing ERISA specialists who handle DOL audits, defend fiduciary liability claims, and navigate the regulations daily

benefits.title: Professional certification
benefits.description: Earn your certificate plus 29.75 SHRM/HRCI continuing education credits

testimonials.quote: IAML once again surpassed my expectations. The seminar was awesome and the degree of information presented to our group was so valuable. I applaud IAML for finding the experts in the various fields and making them available to us. I can hardly wait until the next seminar!
testimonials.author: Bianca Olivarria
testimonials.title: HR Technician & Disability Management Specialist

testimonials.quote: It was great learning the information, but also very useful hearing from others attending the class. I learned a wealth of information.
testimonials.author: Brittney Viator
testimonials.title: Benefits Administrator

testimonials.quote: The instructors did a fantastic job of presenting the information and maintaining participant engagement.
testimonials.author: Sandy Lovett
testimonials.title: Human Resources Generalist

testimonials.quote: All compensation and benefits professionals should consider this seminar. There is a large volume of valuable information presented in an effective, dynamic setting. The speakers are certainly well-equipped and are very attuned to the needs of the class members.
testimonials.author: Todd Hanson
testimonials.title: Corporate Human Resources Manager

testimonials.quote: Instructors were very good and well versed in subject matter. They offered to help and provide materials outside of the seminar.
testimonials.author: Brian Wagner
testimonials.title: Attorney

testimonials.quote: I absolutely loved the instructors! The course provided so much valuable information.
testimonials.author: Emily Ruelle
testimonials.title: Human Resources Generalist

testimonials.quote: This was an excellent seminar and covered everything I'd hoped. The instructors were outstanding.
testimonials.author: Kurt Henkel
testimonials.title: Senior Benefits Plan Analyst

testimonials.quote: I enjoyed the open and casual approach to this training. Everyone appeared comfortable enough to participate and ask questions.
testimonials.author: Deborah Carnelli
testimonials.title: Resolutions and Receivership Specialist

testimonials.quote: I really enjoyed the class. I appreciated Tom Schendt's teaching styles and how he involved everyone in the class and made it interactive. He certainly succeeded in making a potentially boring subject quite fun.
testimonials.author: S. Greg Robinson
testimonials.title: Human Resources Manager

testimonials.quote: I really enjoyed the seminar. I learned a great deal and will definitely be able to apply what I learned once I'm back in the office.
testimonials.author: Alana Tomczyszn
testimonials.title: Human Resources Manager

testimonials.quote: Great job! The information will assist me and my company in effectively administering our employee benefits.
testimonials.author: Julie O'Dell-Michie
testimonials.title: Sr. Vice President & Chief Administrative Officer

testimonials.quote: The instructors did a great job of keeping the participants engaged while covering material that could have been very dry.
testimonials.author: Steven Pennell
testimonials.title: Human Resources Director, Talent & Technology

testimonials.quote: I thoroughly enjoyed the seminar. I really appreciated that the instructors allowed participants to ask questions and work through our issues and concerns.

faq.question: What happens after I register?
faq.answer: Within minutes, you'll receive an invoice email. Once payment is processed, you can schedule your complimentary pre-program consultation (10-15 minutes) to discuss your specific benefits administration challenges and identify which regulatory topics will have the biggest impact for your organization. Pre-program materials arrive one week before your session starts.

faq.question: Can I attend individual blocks instead of the full program?
faq.answer: Yes. While most participants get the best value from the complete 4½-day program, you can register for individual blocks based on your immediate needs. Block I (Retirement Plans Mastery) is $1,375, Block II (Claims, Appeals & Litigation) is $575, and Block III (Health & Welfare Benefits) is $975. The full program at $2,375 saves you $550 versus purchasing all blocks separately.

faq.question: What's the difference between in-person, virtual, and on-demand formats?
faq.answer: All three formats feature the same practicing ERISA attorney instructors, current regulatory content, and professional credits. In-person provides face-to-face networking with other benefits professionals. Virtual delivers the same live instruction via Zoom with full Q&A capability. On-demand lets you learn at your own pace over 90 days. Choose the format that fits your schedule. The quality and content remain identical.

faq.question: What continuing education credits will I earn?
faq.answer: The complete program provides 29.75 SHRM/HRCI/CLE credits. Plus, your enrollment includes 12 months of quarterly employment law updates (4 sessions × 1.5 credits each = 6 additional credits), bringing your total to 35.75 credits. That's more than most professionals earn in two years.

faq.question: Is this program for HR professionals or benefits specialists?
faq.answer: Both. HR generalists gain the ERISA and ACA compliance knowledge to manage benefits without constantly escalating to outside counsel. Benefits specialists and administrators get deeper expertise in fiduciary rules, nondiscrimination testing, and claims litigation. Many organizations also send in-house counsel who advise on benefits matters. The program is designed to be valuable whether you touch benefits daily or manage them as part of a broader HR role.

faq.question: I manage our 401(k) plan but don't handle health benefits. Should I attend the full program?
faq.answer: Consider your exposure. If you only administer retirement plans, Block I (Retirement Plans Mastery) and Block II (Claims, Appeals & Litigation) cover ERISA fiduciary rules, plan corrections, and benefits litigation defense. However, many 401(k) administrators also get questions about health plan issues, and the full program provides context that helps you understand the complete benefits landscape. The pre-program consultation can help you decide which blocks are essential for your situation.

faq.question: How technical is the content? Do I need a legal background?
faq.answer: No legal background required. The program is designed for benefits professionals who need practical compliance knowledge, not law school theory. You'll learn how to handle fiduciary obligations, pass nondiscrimination tests, process QDROs, navigate ACA reporting, and defend benefits claims. Our instructors translate complex ERISA regulations into actionable procedures you can implement Monday morning.

faq.question: Does the $2,375 program fee include everything?
faq.answer: Yes. Your enrollment includes all live instruction from practicing ERISA attorneys, complete program materials, 29.75 continuing education credits, pre-program consultation, 12 months of quarterly employment law updates (4 sessions, $1,588 value), permanent access to updated benefits resources, and alumni benefits for all future programs. The only additional cost would be travel and lodging if you choose in-person format.

faq.question: We're facing a DOL audit. Can this program help?
faq.answer: Absolutely. Block I covers IRS and DOL audit triggers, voluntary correction programs (EPCRS and VFCP), and strategies for fixing plan errors before they become disasters. The pre-program consultation is the perfect time to share your audit situation (confidentially) so our team can point you to the most relevant content. Many participants come with active compliance issues and leave with specific action plans.

faq.question: Will I be ready to handle benefits compliance after completing this program?
faq.answer: Yes. The program is designed for immediate application. You'll leave with frameworks for fiduciary decision-making, nondiscrimination testing procedures, claims administration protocols, ACA reporting checklists, and audit defense strategies. Whether you're managing a 401(k), administering health benefits, or handling COBRA and FMLA coordination, you'll have the regulatory knowledge to make confident decisions and avoid the mistakes that trigger penalties and litigation.
